description: It's a very useful application, I'm using it everywhere.
It has features that haven't been merged into KeePassX, therefore this app is the more progressive one and my daily driver.

Simple, stable, secure local password manager. I've been using KeePassXC and its predecessors for many years to store hundreds of passwords. One of the few programs I use almost every day.

KeePassXC is recommended over plain KeePassX because it is getting more development attention and already has several new features.

Not a bad app - but unusable as when left clicking on a folder, password entry, etc. The entire thing is selected and set to copy / move - so if you attempt to click anywhere else it tries to move / copy the item. This is so infuriating as it makes the app unusable.

Fix this and it will be at least usable.
Does everything it should. I especially like that it is cross-platform. I'm using this PW manager because I trust open source software more than the paid alternatives out there.
Secure and stable, easy to use.
Some functions are not working well, like auto-insert, password generator is not so good as in native KeePass
Simple but extensive interface. Glad to see this app is getting regular updates! And although the app gets updated, the interface stays the same.

no problems so far, you could connect it with nextcloud, so your files would backup and sync between devices.
IMPORTANT!
Don't forget to backup your kdbx file! so you wont lose your data
It does not work XFCE desktop environment of Xubuntu. However, it works very well with Ubuntu. Reduced to 4 star due to above issue.
I was Pretty frustrated when KeePass didn't have a Linux version, and when I discovered this app, I very happy. It works just like KeePass. Thanks for putting this out here!

I'm using Ubuntu 18.04 LTS and having issues opening .kdbx files in the most recent version while they are inside of a veracrypt container. I cannot get it to work for any .kdbx file, but can get it to work in the other older version in the ubuntu package repo. If you run into this problem, just sudo apt install keepassxc through the terminal and use that version. 

Hope this can get fixed, I refuse to store my kdbx files outside of my veracrypt containers.
summary: Wonderful Password Manager - with one hiccup in this version

description: I'm 100% sure of the password. I have no idea why this particular package does not work. So I tried installing it after that from synaptic and it worked. The AppImage version also works. This particular one for some reason didn't.
summary: it is a great app but... unable to open file??

description: Thanks for this awesome tool
Satisfied, useful app.

Very simple, secure, modern and feature-rich. Light on memory and many ways to obtain it ;)
Definitely recommended!

I get the native install browser integration working in a few clicks; this snap package isn't as easy.

I gave up after 3 minutes; I'm too busy to try figure it out; maybe when I have more time.

For now I will stick with the native install
Much better than other in market, thank you guys.
Did not read my mounted folder
best app for keep password

Using this with Ubuntu 18.04.3 and also the Windows version. The keystroke auto-type feature works great in both environments. I am not using any of the browser extensions. The documentation on their website is first-rate. Please donate a few bucks to these guys to support this great software.
summary: Great port of Keepass 2 for local password storage - Highly recommend

description: nice app. Needs update

I use it for critical passwords and keys backup. 

Pro:
- Stable
- Yubikey integration

Cons:
- Web browser integration is lacking
I had some issues with it, but the devs were very responsive and fixed the bugs quickly.
Best linux version I've been able to find.
summary: Easy to use, secure, open source

description: It's pretty simple to use, has a great interface, cool browser integrations and it exports all the passwords as an encrypted file that you can then share among your devices.
Not the prettiest of apps, But does exactly what it says on the tin, I just like the fact passwords are not stored "On the cloud"

Cannot use database stored on google drive.
This makes this port unusable as you can only have local database and it will not be synchronized with the rest devices
summary: Cannot use database stored on google drive

description: After several years it's still unusable with a snap-installed FireFox, nothing can make it work. Developers tell you not to use Snap for the browser... Of course, you should change the whole environment instead of solving the problem. Also, the Android app is cringy, it can't open the DB by the stored path again after re-open the app. That's a failure.
summary: Still can't use it for its purpose

summary: Software OK but snap version has issues with encrypted volumes

description:
I thought snaps would make everything more stable? Presumably with fewer needs from the OS it should always work right? All you need is the OS + Xwindows? Then it does not even launch... Is there no automated testing of apps in teh snap store? maybe use SUSE services for this? 

keepassxc

Workings as expected.

Who need this bad copy of Keepass2?
- no plugins
- no tegs
etc...

I use keepass on ubunut 20.04, Windows 10, and Android with a common database using dropbox and haven't had any compatibily issues at all. There have been a few UI bugs in the past but i haven't had any problems recently and the new update looks super clean!

I like keepassxc. However, it is Qt not Gtk, and hence looks a little out of place. That are my 4 start. 

When I tried the snap package I got a segmentation fault and as a result the app did not start.

This snap version cannot access kdbx files on an NFS mount. This app on the apt store can. I had to revert to the older version on apt.
Love this app

description: i would love to try but won't start on ubuntu 20.4
Works very well, easy to use. This app helps a lot in digital privacy

First, This program launches which is more than I can say for the majority of programs on the software store. 

It gets 3 stars just for that.

I cannot give this program more because It cannot access my keepass.kdbx database on my google drive and is thus useless to me.

description:
after 2 newest update it forget database and need to redirect
even history is clear

Works across Linux, iOS, and Windows. Has Chrome integration through a plugin, serves your SSH keys to ssh-agent, can serve as a keychain, and can generate OTPs. There is also an Android app that supports KeepassXC databases. Highly recommended.
This app is safe, secure, open source, and works excellent on Linux. If you care about privacy get this application and use it.
I really like this app. I think it's even better than the Windows one. Thanks
summary: The last update is really cool

description: Can't open files on my google drive. Bit of a deal-breaker for me.
summary: It's good, but has a major flaw..

description: Error in that is could not save the DB. Climing that it did not have permission. I checked this and ensured that the db file was writable by the user in question. No go. I suppose Canonical should focus on geting theis to really work, or just use flathub or appimages...

description: stopped working, good as long as it worked

description: Uso há muitos anos no Android, Linux e Windows com muita satisfação. Algumas empresas que conheço também utilizam.
It's a good app for storing password in a local database
This is a very complex and complicated tool. If you are not a developer I do not advise
Provide all of the features I want.

All functionality required by a password manager are available and working as expected, plus the developers are adding new functionality regularly (compared to the original KeePassX), although they are not needed for my use case
summary: Probably the best offline password manager

description: Great password manager with huge functionality
phone, laptop, linux, windows, everywhere
keepassxc's snap refreshed and moved from 2.6.2 -> 2.6.4. Since then, my password DB won't open. Fcuk!

The program can't access mounted drives. It can't get a db from a drive that it not the OS partition and it can't access /media drives mounted like USBs. I store my Key files on USB drive which works fine with other KeePass software

163.3 MB size is huge. Wonder correct or error.
I installed similar one KeePassX ( about 0.5 MB)Now repository has similar one KeePass 2
I like it. thanks
Very good applications. I like it !

summary: Easy to install, nice layout, but..

description:
After a long search i found the following: "You cannot use ssh agent with the snap distribution due to sandboxing." *1 
If you do not intend to use that feature, the snap will probably be okay. It worked for me at least. 
If you DO want to use ssh-agent features see *2 to install the "regular PPA" version. 


1) https://github.com/keepassxreboot/keepassxc/issues/4046#issuecomment-567895860 
2) https://keepassxc.org/blog/2017-10-25-ubuntu-ppa/
summary: Great app, love it. Don't use SNAP when using a key agent

description: It can't even open other drives even though it has permissions.
summary: It can't open other drives even though it has permissions

description: It comes with Kubuntu as default but can't access folders even with the right permission. Intall the other one in the Discover.
this is the best because its offline and give you all control to your database and it fill so good even out side the browser
Beautiful and simple password manager
Please, fix yubikey support to challenge-response.
It is really good!
Cant read database, because snap package cant access dot folders like ~/.keypass
It was what i needed

I have been using Keepass in general since 2009, and XC for sometime now. Works perfectly with Keepass2Android. We have been syncing the password files over several Androids, Windows and Linux devices at the same time, with Owncloud/Nextcloud since 2016 and with Dropbox before that. Never have had a single problem what so ever.
Imported my csv file from Bitwarden, the database couldn't recognise anything. No metadata whatsoever, essentially making it useless.

Font size is microscopic. Absolutely unusuable! Switching out of compact mode causes the app to expand to 1000% of its normal size... and still has the microscopic unreadable font! People are complaining about it all over the internet!
summary: Garbage! Application screen fonts size too small. Unreadable!

description: It has so many bugs that it is barely useble. The other one in the store works way better
no connection with Firefox, Chromium, Google Chrome or ChrEdge

In contrast to the NordPass app which i was using before (ok, that costs and is proprietary code) I tried several hours in vain to connect it to Firefox or Brave. I also miss the function to store Secure Notes with longer text.
Tool handles the basic. I'd really like it to be able to recognize mounted network drives.
as FF nowadays is installed as snap, KeepassXC is not longer working. hope you can rectify

Font size is microscopic. Absolutely unusuable! Switching out of compact mode causes the app to expand to 1000% of its normal size... and still has the microscopic unreadable font! People are complaining about it all over the internet!

It won't open any valid .kdbx database even if it was created by this application (KeePassXC 2.7.1) before. "File /run/1000/doc/eee24b78/filename.kdbx doesn't exist." failure message is shown.
KeePass2, KeePassXC 2.3.1 and KeePassXC 2.6.6 open databases that were created by KeePassXC 2.7.1 ...

Software Center lulls you too much. Go to the official Keepassxc website, import the public key and get the appimage PGP signature, verify it, run the downloaded appimage. Ubuntu 18.04 LTS 64 needs the appimage. Opens earlier keepasscx databases stored inside a Veracrypt crypt container. Try to do that with this software center version and you'll tear your hair out changing file permissions and still get a "file does not exist" message and not open the database.
summary: It is an upgrade that does work, but not from the software center

description:
Pending issue: github.com/keepassxreboot/keepassxc/issues/7739
switch to flatpak version

Das Programm versucht Keepass auf Linux zu sein, sieht auch schon danach aus und hat auch viele Funktionen des Vorbildes schon implementiert.
Allerdings läuft es sehr zäh und langsam und kann Datenbanken im Netzwerk nicht öffnen, weil es sie gar nicht erst findet.
Ich bevorzuge eindeutig Keepassx, obwohl es weniger Funktionen hat und die Weiterentwicklung stockt. Es läuft aber schnell und Alles funktioniert.
Keepass unter Mono oder Wine ist auch eine deutlich bessere Lösung.
summary: Guter Ansatz, muß aber noch solider werden

description: Ridiculously large installation, crashes immediately when clicking "open an existing file"
Tut was es soll. Macht keine Probleme. KEYS von Keepassx werden direkt anerkannt und geöffnet.
Die Datenbank lässt sich einbinden, jedoch kommt keine Verbindung mit dem Browser und dessen Browserplugin zustande, weder im Firefox noch im Chrome. Schade
No Problems Works as intended
Die Installation funzt perfekt, jedoch das Verbinden mit Firefox Browser 72.0.1 gibt immer Fehlermeldung aus. Es muss die Browsereinbindung aktiviert sein. Ist aktiviert und leider will es nicht.
Keine Probleme festsetllbar. Arbeitet zuverlässig und schnell.
Die Icons sind leider nicht an 4K Auflösungen angepasst. Wenn das noch geändert würde, läuft's großartig.
summary: Leider keine vollständige Anpassung an hohe Auflösungen

description: Hab einige KeePass-solutions für Linux getestet. Das kommt am nähersten an das Original.

Wer einen einfaches Tool zur Verwaltung seiner Passwörter sucht, ist hier richtig. Um KeePassXC vor unbefugten Einblicken zu schützen, kann man sogar einen einzigartigen Key auf USB speichern und nur darüber das Prog. entsperren.
Könnet allerdings mal ein Facelift vertragen.
Sehr guter Passwortmanager, hat sich in den letzten Monaten nochmal ordentlich verbessert.
Ist sehr nützlich und gut bearbeitet.

Super Passwortmanager :-)

Die Berechtigungen nach der Installation erlauben keinen Zugriff auf die persönlichen Ordner, oder externe Laufwerke. Das kann nicht funktionieren, wenn man einen Passwortsafe öffnen möchte. Nach dem ändern der Berechtigungen, funktioniert aber alles, wie es soll :-)
Apropos Berechtigungen: OpenGL und Netzwerkzugriff sind offenbar nicht unbedingt notwendig.
summary: Wenn man die Berechtigungen passend setzt, funktioniert alles top :-)

description:
KeePassXC ist der beste persönliche Passwortmanager überhaupt.
Die Anwendung ist schnell, modern und hat sehr viele nützliche Funktionen.
Die Handhabung ist sehr einfach und falls Probleme auftreten (was ich bisher noch nie hatte), gibt es viele Lösungen im Internet.

Ich benutze die Software für Windows und für Linux und da das Programm genau gleich aufgebaut ist, muss man nicht noch alles neu lernen oder sich mit verschiedenen Programmen herumschlagen.
Die gut strukturierte Oberfläche läßt keine Wünsche offen, es fällt Jedem leicht sich direkt zu orientieren
Ist zwar ein nettes Programm, aber ohne funktionierende Browser.-Integration ziemlich umständlich

Ich bekomme die Meldung: "Ein anderer Secret Service läuft bereits(PID: unbekannt; Programmdatei: unbekannt)". Da es sich um eine neue Ubuntu-Installation handelt, kann es eigentlich nur der "gnome-Keyring" sein? Ich habe leider keine brauchbare Anleitung gefunden um KeePassXC zum laufen zu bringen.
Schade: Das Tool macht sonst einen hervorragenden Eindruck und die Online-Dokumentation ist wirklich Klasse.
the programm is unable to open my KeePass database file.
Installation, Start, Entschlüsselung der KeePass 2 - Datei, die mit KeePass erstellt wurde, funktioniert sehr gut.
Browser Integration läuft, der Passwortgenerator könnte noch etwas besser werden. Ansonsten funktionabel schon seit Jahren im einsatz- vielen Dank!
der Import aus KeePass(Windows) hat sunktioniert
Eigentlich würde ich gerne 5 Sterne vergeben: KeepassXC ist eine super Sache. Leider unbenutzbar durch die Limitierung durch snap auf das Homeverzeichnis.
summary: Eigentlich toll, aber duch snap unbenutzbar

description: Nach Installation von KeyPassXC: Datenbank vom Windows-PC kopiert und sofort erfolgreich geöffnet. Weitere Erfahrungen unter Ubuntu: noch Fehlanzeige

Achtung, ich denke das ist nicht die offizelle Orginalversion. Einige Funktionen wie der Challenge-Response von Yubikey oder das beziehen der Datenbank aus einer Cloud sind nicht unterstützt. 
Orginal: 'sudo apt-get install keepassxc'
look really good, like the windows version, but its unusable due to an permission error when trying to use mounted partitions for the source database or keyfile.
ich finde es sehr gut
Es una buena aplicación
Sincronización de base datos es lo único q le falta.
summary: plugin para sincronizar base de datos con el móvil

description: gfdsswer45t6y7u
Que es excelente

Lo usaba desde hace tiempo, hasta que al copiar el archivo .kdbx, y cambiarlo de disco, es incapaz de abrilo de nuevo.

Sólo abre el archivo .kdbx que está en la unidad, donde se generó, por primera vez.

Una de esas aplicaciones que va siempre conmigo. Gestiono la base de datos guardada en la nube (Dropbox, por ejemplo) y puedo tenerla siempre actualizada en los ordenadores y los teléfonos.
Una vez sabes cómo funciona es muy sencillo gestionar las contraseñas con carpetas para tenerlas organizadas.

De todas las aplicaciones que buscaba para administrar mis contraseñas, esta me dejo muy satisfecho. Se agradece a los desarrolladores, espero que sigan mejorando esta aplicacion mas de la que ya esta...
summary: Para gestionar y encriptar contraseñas. Muy bueno..

description: GG dfgdfg rerdrgdrgdrgdrgrdgrd

description: Tiene lo necesario, fundamentalmente en las reservas prácticas de las claves y sin necesidad de la sincronización.
summary: Esta aplicación es excelente y muy útil. ¡Muchas gracias!

description: Hace tiempo que la vengo usando, se las recomiendo, sobre todo por lo facil y sencilla que es de usar. Aperte uno le puede agregar los iconos que quiera.
Me encanta y cada vez me encanda más

Gestionnaire de mot de passe possédant de nombreuses fonctions :
- Compatible avec fichier kdbx
- Générateur de mot de passe
- Auto-type
- Expiration de mot de passe
- Gestion clé Yubikey
C'est l'application a utiliser pour stocker ses mot de passe !
summary: Très bon gestionnaire de mot de passe

description:
On est le jour J de la sortie 30-10-2019.

Tentative utilisation ancienne base je reviens de Keepassxc version 2.3.1 pour info ma base à l'extension ".kdbx" .Du coup re tour sur version antérieure. 

Bonnne journée !
Une bonne application snap, je vous la conseille !
On est en 2020?
Nous utilisons KeePass quotidiennement au travail. Un indispensable !

De retour sur Linux après des années d'absence, je souhaite m'investir sur cette nouvelle LTS.

Super content de retrouver de quoi exploiter ma base KeePass. Surpris en revanche de ne pas pouvoir accéder à mon NAS pour importer ma base de données.

C'est prévu j'espère ?

Simon
Les fichiers sont à l'abri avec efficacité.
summary: Parfait pour ce que je veux sécuriser

description: La version principale de KeePass est beaucoup plus ergonomique à bien des égards, cependant on retrouve toutes ses fonctionnalités dans KeePass XC... mais avec une interface encore plus moche (je doutais que ce fût possible). Le seul problème est le remplissage automatique dans un navigateur qui semble beaucoup plus compliqué à configurer que sur Windows
summary: un bon compromis à KeePass pour Windows

description: Fonctionne niquel et version à jour identique au site officiel

On pourrait reprocher une interface franchement austère et l'impossibilité d'ouvrir un .kdbx depuis un lecteur réseau.

Mais ça fait parfaitement le taff et c'est finalement ce qu'on attends de l'outil.

Pour ouvrir une base stockée en réseau, il faut aller ouvrir directement le fichier de la base de donnée. KeePassXC s'en souvriendra lors de la prochaine ouverture, si vous êtes authentifié sur votre stockage distant votre base s'ouvrira sans problème.
Super programme merci !! Meilleur que KeePass en terme d'ergonomie et d'intégration. Et les yubikey sont désormais parfaitement intégrées c'est vraiment du beau boulot !

Simple à utiliser grâce à une IHM claire.
Les saisies sont très rapides car très bien coordonnées et assistées de nombreuses routines clavier/souris.
Dommage, la version snap ne permet pas d'accéder à un fichier clé situé dans mon répertoire utilisateur .ssh... un comble !
summary: Dommage, droits d'accès impossible sur dossier .ssh

description: permais de conserver TOUS les codes dans un fichier crypté, saisie intuitive, TRÈS BON BOULOT.

L'application dit que le mot de passe est invalide, alors que KeepassX fonctionne parfaitement.

Appli inutile
Keepass est indispensable pour la gestion de mot de passe.
summary: Ouverture de ma base Keepass de windows sans problème

description: All work stable.
В deb-репозитория более старая версия, но она работает нормально. А эта версия выдает огромные значки, и весь интерфейс разъезжается. Что-то с масштабированием шрифтов.
Лучшая программа из менеджеров паролей. Много лет пользовался на винде, но только сегодня узнал, что она есть и на лине.

Cool stable app. Works fast and stable.
Fresh new look add more usability and nice view.
Некорректно отображается на hidpi экране при масштабировании 200%
summary: Некорректно отображается на hidpi экране при масштабировании 200%

description: Отличная программа, работает нормально.

Последняя версия очень радует, но в программе из snap пакета есть проблема на HiDpi экране 4k при масштабировании 200%, разметка съезжает, окно узкое и высокое с мелкими кнопочками. В версии из ppa репозитория проблем нет, работает отлично. Просьба исправить, сборку snap пакета!
summary: Есть проблемы на HiDpi экране 4k при масштабировании 200%

description:
OS Linux Kubuntu 20.04 user
Проблемма связана с нехваткой прав при указанием пути на файл, который расположен на съемном носителе (а так же в другие директории). Возможно со snap пакетом и правами непосредственно на него, при этом используется непонятный фаловый менеджер, больше похож на стандартный Ubuntu.

# snap list
keepassxc 2.6.2 1136 latest/stable keepassxreboot -

# cat /etc/passwd | grep и /etc/group | grep
не дали ничего по snap или keepassxc 

Программа отличная, нехватает автосейв с интервалом. В предыдущей версии потерял 8 часов работы и 200 записей паролей из-за отсутствия автосейва. "Автосохранение после каждого изменения" откючал, потому как безбожно тормозит (Графическая оболочка становится безжизненной пока идет шифрование файла *.kdbx на добрых 20-30 секунд). Если бы шифрование файла не влияло на работу графики , не отключалбы схранение после каждого изменения. Потому как потерять 1:30-2:00 часа времени на сохранение на 200 записях это сильно круто, при том что у меня 800 записей.
Программа работает отлично. Абсолютно никаких претензий.
Но Gorilla, которой пользуюсь давно, тоже хороша. Глаза разбегаются. Даже не знаю, на чём остановиться.
Лучшая в своем роде.
zametcatelnoаваа
Незабытое приложение в отличие от keepassx
Интеграция с браузерами так и не заработала
